reference: Volume Four, Issue Forty, File 12 of 14
title: Phrack World News
authors: Datastream Cowboy, Knight Lightning, The Gatsby
short_summary: This article covers the seizure of the Scantronics BBS by the San Diego Police Department, detailing the investigation into credit card fraud and hacking activities involving a young hacker known as Multiplexor. It provides insights into the hacker community and law enforcement's approach to cybercrime during the early 1990s.
summary:
The article presents a detailed account of the seizure of the Scantronics BBS by the San Diego Police Department, focusing on the investigation of a young hacker named John Edward Semenick, also known as Multiplexor. The narrative unfolds with the police's discovery of credit card information linked to Semenick, leading to his eventual apprehension. The investigation reveals the existence of a larger hacker community and the illegal activities associated with it, including 'carding'â€”the fraudulent use of credit cards. The police reports included in the article provide a glimpse into the methods used by law enforcement to gather intelligence on hackers and their operations, showcasing the tension between the hacker culture and law enforcement during this period.

Furthermore, the article highlights the involvement of other key figures in the hacker community, such as Kevin Marcus, known as The Crypt Keeper, who provided information to the police about the activities on Scantronics BBS. The investigation not only sheds light on the criminal aspects of hacking but also raises questions about the motivations and ethics of young hackers. It serves as a historical snapshot of the early 1990s hacker scene, illustrating the challenges faced by law enforcement in addressing cybercrime and the complexities of the hacker identity.
